title: Old default judgment with new wage garnishment Have complete records found sol expired prior to Court issue of judgment
question: Default judgment issued 10/03/2003 PMGI LLC original creditor Bank of America No collection attempts Renewed 07/20/2012 Writ of execution unsatisfied. Writ of execution 06/20/2014 Found employer Wage garnishment to start 10/01/2014 reviewed files found all statements and correspondence verified month to month complete and accurate accounting Last payment and communication made 06/09/1999 Four years four months prior to issue of default judgment
answers:
Until the default judgment is set aside by the the court, your affirmative defense of the statute of limitations does not affect this lawsuit, because it is an "affirmative defense." However, if this was not your debt or you never were served and only learned of it when they recently contacted your or started to garnish your wages (soon), then you may have a claim against them for debt collection harassment, including suing you on a time-barred debt, known as a "Kimber" violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

You need a complete copy of the court's case file to send to a debt collection DEFENSE attorney for analysis to see what measures to take to help resolve this and stop the default judgment and wage garnishment.

Consult an experienced debt collection DEFENSE counsel and please see DISCLAIMER, below.

If I am following you, the problem is that the law only requires that the lawsuit be filed within the statute, not that the judgment be issued. If you were properly served and failed to raise that issue in your responses, you may have waived that argument by not presenting it. In any event you can an AVVO attorney in your area to sit down and review all of this with, to see if there some chance of re-litigating the judgment or perhaps filing for bankruptcy protection to stop the garnishment.
